verses.textEn: Paul and Timothy, servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons.
verses.textLa: Paulus, et Timotheus servi Iesu Christi, omnibus sanctis in Christo Iesu, qui sunt Philippis, cum episcopis, et diaconibus.

verses.textEn: Grace and peace to you, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.textLa: Gratia vobis, et pax a Deo Patre nostro, et Domino Iesu Christo.

verses.textEn: I give thanks to my God, with every remembrance of you,
verses.textLa: Gratias ago Deo meo in omni memoria vestri,

verses.textEn: always, in all my prayers, making supplication for all of you with joy,
verses.textLa: semper in cunctis orationibus meis pro omnibus vobis, cum gaudio deprecationem faciens,

verses.textEn: because of your communion in the Gospel of Christ, from the first day even until now.
verses.textLa: super communicatione vestra in Evangelio Christi a prima die usque nunc.

verses.textEn: I am confident of this very thing: that he who has begun this good work in you will perfect it, unto the day of Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: Confidens hoc ipsum, quia qui cœpit in vobis opus bonum, perficiet usque in diem Christi Iesu.

verses.textEn: So then, it is right for me to feel this way about all of you, because I hold you in my heart, and because, in my chains and in the defense and confirmation of the Gospel, you all are partakers of my joy.
verses.textLa: Sicut est mihi iustum hoc sentire pro omnibus vobis: eo quod habeam vos in corde, et in vinculis meis, et in defensione, et confirmatione Evangelii, socios gaudii mei omnes vos esse.

verses.textEn: For God is my witness how, within the heart of Jesus Christ, I long for all of you.
verses.textLa: Testis enim mihi est Deus, quomodo cupiam omnes vos in visceribus Iesu Christi.

verses.textEn: And this I pray: that your charity may abound more and more, with knowledge and with all understanding,
verses.textLa: Et hoc oro ut charitas vestra magis ac magis abundet in scientia, et in omni sensu:

verses.textEn: so that you may be confirmed in what is better, in order that you may be sincere and without offense on the day of Christ:
verses.textLa: ut probetis potiora, ut sitis sinceri, et sine offensa in diem Christi,

verses.textEn: filled with the fruit of justice, through Jesus Christ, in the glory and praise of God.
verses.textLa: repleti fructu iustitiæ per Iesum Christum, in gloriam et laudem Dei.

verses.textEn: Now, brothers, I want you to know that the things concerning me happened for the advancement of the Gospel,
verses.textLa: Scire autem vos volo fratres, quia quæ circa me sunt, magis ad profectum venerunt Evangelii:

verses.textEn: in such a way that my chains have become manifest in Christ in every place of judgment and in all other such places.
verses.textLa: ita ut vincula mea manifesta fierent in Christo in omni prætorio, et in ceteris omnibus,

verses.textEn: And many from among the brothers in the Lord, becoming confident through my chains, are now much bolder in speaking the Word of God without fear.
verses.textLa: et plures e fratribus in Domino confidentes vinculis meis, abundantius auderent sine timore Verbum Dei loqui.

verses.textEn: Certainly, some do so even because of envy and contention; and others, too, do so because of a good will to preach Christ.
verses.textLa: Quidam quidem et propter invidiam, et contentionem: quidam autem et propter bonam voluntatem Christum prædicant:

verses.textEn: Some act out of charity, knowing that I have been appointed for the defense of the Gospel.
verses.textLa: quidam ex charitate: scientes quoniam in defensionem Evangelii positus sum.

verses.textEn: But others, out of contention, announce Christ insincerely, claiming that their difficulties lift them up to my chains.
verses.textLa: Quidam autem ex contentione Christum annunciant non sincere, existimantes pressuram se suscitare vinculis meis.

verses.textEn: But what does it matter? As long as, by every means, whether under pretext or in truthfulness, Christ is announced. And about this, I rejoice, and moreover, I will continue to rejoice.
verses.textLa: Quid enim? Dum omni modo sive per occasionem, sive per veritatem Christus annuncietur: et in hoc gaudeo, sed et gaudebo.
verses.notes: The word ‘occasionem,’ in this context, refers to acting under a pretext; it does not refer to an occasion or an opportunity. Thus, ‘veritatem’ is not so much ‘the truth’ as preaching or announcing Christ with truthfulness, that is, out of sincere motives.

verses.textEn: For I know that this will bring me to salvation, through your prayers and under the ministration of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
verses.textLa: Scio enim quia hoc mihi proveniet ad salutem, per vestram orationem, et subministrationem Spiritus Iesu Christi,

verses.textEn: by means of my own expectation and hope. For in nothing shall I be confounded. Instead, with all confidence, now just as always, Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether by life or by death.
verses.textLa: secundum expectationem, et spem meam, quia in nullo confundar: sed in omni fiducia sicut semper, et nunc magnificabitur Christus in corpore meo, sive per vitam, sive per mortem.

verses.textEn: For to me, to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
verses.textLa: Mihi enim vivere Christus est, et mori lucrum.

verses.textEn: And while I live in the flesh, for me, there is the fruit of works. But I do not know which I would choose.
verses.textLa: Quod si vivere in carne, hic mihi fructus operis est, et quid eligam ignoro.

verses.textEn: For I am constrained between the two: having a desire to be dissolved and to be with Christ, which is the far better thing,
verses.textLa: Coarctor autem e duobus: desiderium habens dissolvi, et esse cum Christo, multo magis melius:

verses.textEn: but then to remain in the flesh is necessary for your sake.
verses.textLa: permanere autem in carne, necessarium propter vos.

verses.textEn: And having this confidence, I know that I shall remain and that I shall continue to remain with all of you, for your advancement and for your joy in the faith,
verses.textLa: Et hoc confidens scio quia manebo, et permanebo omnibus vobis ad profectum vestrum, et gaudium fidei:

verses.textEn: so that your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus for me, through my return to you again.
verses.textLa: ut gratulatio vestra abundet in Christo Iesu in me, per meum adventum iterum ad vos.

verses.textEn: Only let your behavior be worthy of the Gospel of Christ, so that, whether I return and see you, or whether, being absent, I hear about you, still you may stand firm with one spirit, with one mind, laboring together for the faith of the Gospel.
verses.textLa: Tantum digne Evangelio Christi conversamini: ut sive cum venero, et videro vos, sive absens audiam de vobis quia statis in uno spiritu unanimes, collaborantes fidei Evangelii:

verses.textEn: And in nothing be terrified by the adversaries. For what is to them an occasion of perdition, is to you an occasion of salvation, and this is from God.
verses.textLa: et in nullo terreamini ab adversariis: quæ illis est causa perditionis, vobis autem salutis, et hoc a Deo:

verses.textEn: For this has been given to you on behalf of Christ, not only so that you may believe in him, but even so that you may suffer with him,
verses.textLa: quia vobis donatum est pro Christo, non solum ut in eum credatis, sed ut etiam pro illo patiamini:

verses.textEn: engaging in the same struggle, of a kind which you also have seen in me, and which you now have heard from me.
verses.textLa: idem certamen habentes, quale et vidistis in me, et nunc audistis de me.

verses.textEn: Therefore, if there is any consolation in Christ, any solace of charity, any fellowship of the Spirit, any feelings of commiseration:
verses.textLa: Si qua ergo consolatio in Christo, si quod solatium charitatis, si qua societas spiritus, si qua viscera miserationis:

verses.textEn: complete my joy by having the same understanding, holding to the same charity, being of one mind, with the same sentiment.
verses.textLa: implete gaudium meum ut idem sapiatis, eandem charitatem habentes, unanimes, idipsum sentientes,

verses.textEn: Let nothing be done by contention, nor in vain glory. Instead, in humility, let each of you esteem others to be better than himself.
verses.textLa: nihil per contentionem, neque per inanem gloriam: sed in humilitate superiores sibi invicem arbitrantes,

verses.textEn: Let each of you not consider anything to be your own, but rather to belong to others.
verses.textLa: non quæ sua sunt singuli considerantes, sed ea, quæ aliorum.

verses.textEn: For this understanding in you was also in Christ Jesus:
verses.textLa: Hoc enim sentite in vobis, quod et in Christo Iesu:

verses.textEn: who, though he was in the form of God, did not consider equality with God something to be seized.
verses.textLa: qui cum in forma Dei esset, non rapinam arbitratus est esse se æqualem Deo:
verses.notes: The Three Persons of the Trinity are equal in Divine Nature, but not equal in Divine Personhood.

verses.textEn: Instead, he emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, being made in the likeness of men, and accepting the state of a man.
verses.textLa: sed semetipsum exinanivit formam servi accipiens, in similitudinem hominum factus, et habitu inventus ut homo.

verses.textEn: He humbled himself, becoming obedient even unto death, even the death of the Cross.
verses.textLa: Humiliavit semetipsum factus obediens usque ad mortem, mortem autem crucis.

verses.textEn: Because of this, God has also exalted him and has given him a name which is above every name,
verses.textLa: Propter quod et Deus exaltavit illum, et donavit illi nomen, quod est super omne nomen:

verses.textEn: so that, at the name of Jesus, every knee would bend, of those in heaven, of those on earth, and of those in hell,
verses.textLa: ut in nomine Iesu omne genu flectatur cælestium, terrestrium, et infernorum,
verses.notes: Even in hell, the souls there know and admit that Jesus Christ is the Lord of all Creation, of heaven and of earth and of hell.

verses.textEn: and so that every tongue would confess that the Lord Jesus Christ is in the glory of God the Father.
verses.textLa: et omnis lingua confiteatur quia Dominus Iesus Christus in gloria est Dei Patris.

verses.textEn: And so, my most beloved, just as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence, but even more so now in my absence: work toward your salvation with fear and trembling.
verses.textLa: Itaque charissimi mei (sicut semper obedistis): non ut in præsentia mei tantum, sed multo magis nunc in absentia mea, cum metu et tremore vestram salutem operamini.

verses.textEn: For it is God who works in you, both so as to choose, and so as to act, in accord with his good will.
verses.textLa: Deus est enim, qui operatur in vobis et velle, et perficere pro bona voluntate.

verses.textEn: And do everything without murmuring or hesitation.
verses.textLa: Omnia autem facite sine murmurationibus, et hæsitationibus:

verses.textEn: So may you be without blame, simple sons of God, without reproof, in the midst of a depraved and perverse nation, among whom you shine like lights in the world,
verses.textLa: ut sitis sine querela, et simplices filii Dei, sine reprehensione in medio nationis pravæ, et perversæ: inter quos lucetis sicut luminaria in mundo,

verses.textEn: holding to the Word of Life, until my glory in the day of Christ. For I have not run in vain, nor have I labored in vain.
verses.textLa: verbum vitæ continentes ad gloriam meam in die Christi, quia non in vacuum cucurri, neque in vacuum laboravi.

verses.textEn: Moreover, if I am to be immolated because of the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice and give thanks with all of you.
verses.textLa: Sed et si immolor supra sacrificium, et obsequium fidei vestræ, gaudeo, et congratulor omnibus vobis.

verses.textEn: And over this same thing, you also should rejoice and give thanks, together with me.
verses.textLa: Idipsum autem et vos gaudete, et congratulamini mihi.

verses.textEn: Now I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, in order that I may be encouraged, when I know the things concerning you.
verses.textLa: Spero autem in Domino Iesu, Timotheum me cito mittere ad vos: ut et ego bono animo sim, cognitis quæ circa vos sunt.

verses.textEn: For I have no one else with such an agreeable mind, who, with sincere affection, is solicitous for you.
verses.textLa: Neminem enim habeo tam unanimem, qui sincera affectione pro vobis solicitus sit.

verses.textEn: For they all seek the things that are of themselves, not the things that are of Jesus Christ.
verses.textLa: Omnes enim quæ sua sunt quærunt, non quæ sunt Iesu Christi.

verses.textEn: So know this evidence of him: that like a son with a father, so has he served with me in the Gospel.
verses.textLa: Experimentum autem eius cognoscite, quia sicut patri filius, mecum servivit in Evangelio.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I hope to send him to you immediately, as soon as I see what will happen concerning me.
verses.textLa: Hunc igitur spero me mittere ad vos, mox ut videro quæ circa me sunt.

verses.textEn: But I trust in the Lord that I myself will also return to you soon.
verses.textLa: Confido autem in Domino quoniam et ipse veniam ad vos cito.

verses.textEn: Now I have considered it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and co-worker, and fellow soldier, and an attendant to my needs, but your Apostle.
verses.textLa: Necessarium autem existimavi Epaphroditum fratrem, et cooperatorem, et commilitonem meum, vestrum autem Apostolum, et ministrum necessitatis meæ, mittere ad vos:

verses.textEn: For certainly, he has desired all of you, and he was saddened because you had heard that he was sick.
verses.textLa: quoniam quidem omnes vos desiderabat: et mœstus erat, propterea quod audieratis illum infirmatum.

verses.textEn: For he was sick, even unto death, but God took pity on him, and not only on him, but truly on myself also, so that I would not have sorrow upon sorrow.
verses.textLa: Nam et infirmatus est usque ad mortem: sed Deus misertus est eius: non solum autem eius, verum etiam et mei, ne tristitiam super tristitiam haberem.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I sent him more readily, in order that, by seeing him again, you may rejoice, and I may be without sorrow.
verses.textLa: Festinantius ergo misi illum, ut viso eo iterum gaudeatis, et ego sine tristitia sim.

verses.textEn: And so, receive him with every joy in the Lord, and treat all those like him with honor.
verses.textLa: Excipite itaque illum cum omni gaudio in Domino, et eiusmodi cum honore habetote.

verses.textEn: For he was brought close even to death, for the sake of the work of Christ, handing over his own life, so that he might fulfill what was lacking from you concerning my service.
verses.textLa: Quoniam propter opus Christi usque ad mortem accessit, tradens animam suam ut impleret id, quod ex vobis deerat erga meum obsequium.

verses.textEn: Concerning other things, my brothers, rejoice in the Lord. It is certainly not tiresome for me to write the same things to you, but for you, it is not necessary.
verses.textLa: De cetero fratres mei gaudete in Domino. Eadem vobis scribere, mihi quidem non pigrum, vobis autem necessarium.

verses.textEn: Beware of dogs; beware of those who work evil; beware of those who are divisive.
verses.textLa: Videte canes, videte malos operarios, videte concisionem.

verses.textEn: For we are the circumcised, we who serve God in the Spirit and who glory in Christ Jesus, having no confidence in the flesh.
verses.textLa: Nos enim sumus circumcisio, qui spiritu servimus Deo, et gloriamur in Christo Iesu, et non in carne fiduciam habentes,

verses.textEn: Nevertheless, I might have confidence also in the flesh, for if anyone else seems to have confidence in the flesh, more so do I.
verses.textLa: quamquam ego habeam confidentiam et in carne. Si quis alius videtur confidere in carne, ego magis,

verses.textEn: For I was circumcised on the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, from the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew among Hebrews. According to the law, I was a Pharisee;
verses.textLa: circumcisus octavo die, ex genere Israel, de tribu Beniamin, Hebræus ex Hebræis, secundum legem Pharisæus,

verses.textEn: according to zeal, I persecuted the Church of God; according to the justice that is in the law, I lived without blame.
verses.textLa: secundum æmulationem persequens Ecclesiam Dei, secundum iustitiam, quæ in lege est, conversatus sine querela:
verses.notes: The word ‘conversatus’ refers more to behavior and to a manner of living, than to actual spoken conversation.

verses.textEn: But the things which had been to my gain, the same have I considered a loss, for the sake of Christ.
verses.textLa: Sed quæ mihi fuerunt lucra, hæc arbitratus sum propter Christum detrimenta.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, I consider everything to be a loss, because of the preeminent knowledge of Jesus Christ, my Lord, for whose sake I have suffered the loss of everything, considering it all to be like dung, so that I may gain Christ,
verses.textLa: Verumtamen existimo omnia detrimentum esse propter eminentem scientiam Iesu Christi Domini mei: propter quem omnia detrimentum feci, et arbitror ut stercora, ut Christum lucrifaciam,

verses.textEn: and so that you may be found in him, not having my justice, which is of the law, but that which is of the faith of Christ Jesus, the justice within faith, which is of God.
verses.textLa: et inveniar in illo non habens meam iustitiam, quæ ex lege est, sed illam, quæ ex fide est Christi Iesu: quæ ex Deo est iustitia in fide

verses.textEn: So shall I know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his Passion, having been fashioned according to his death,
verses.textLa: ad cognoscendum illum, et virtutem resurrectionis eius, et societatem Passionum illius: configuratus morti eius:

verses.textEn: if, by some means, I might attain to the resurrection which is from the dead.
verses.textLa: si quo modo occurram ad resurrectionem, quæ est ex mortuis:

verses.textEn: It is not as though I have already received this, or were already perfect. But rather I pursue, so that by some means I might attain, that in which I have already been attained by Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: non quod iam acceperim, aut iam perfectus sim: sequor autem, si quomodo comprehendam in quo et comprehensus sum a Christo Iesu.

verses.textEn: Brothers, I do not consider that I have already attained this. Instead, I do one thing: forgetting those things that are behind, and extending myself toward those things that are ahead,
verses.textLa: Fratres, ego me non arbitror comprehendisse. Unum autem: quæ quidem retro sunt obliviscens, ad ea vero, quæ sunt priora, extendens meipsum,

verses.textEn: I pursue the destination, the prize of the heavenly calling of God in Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: ad destinatum persequor, ad bravium supernæ vocationis Dei in Christo Iesu.

verses.textEn: Therefore, as many of us as are being perfected, let us agree about this. And if in anything you disagree, God will reveal this to you also.
verses.textLa: Quicumque ergo perfecti sumus, hoc sentiamus: et si quid aliter sapitis, et hoc vobis Deus revelabit.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, whatever point we reach, let us be of the same mind, and let us remain in the same rule.
verses.textLa: Verumtamen ad quod pervenimus ut idem sapiamus, et in eadem permaneamus regula.

verses.textEn: Be imitators of me, brothers, and observe those who are walking similarly, just as you have seen by our example.
verses.textLa: Imitatores mei estote fratres, et observate eos qui ita ambulant, sicut habetis formam nostram.

verses.textEn: For many persons, about whom I have often told you (and now tell you, weeping,) are walking as enemies of the cross of Christ.
verses.textLa: Multi enim ambulant, quos sæpe dicebam vobis (nunc autem et flens dico) inimicos crucis Christi:

verses.textEn: Their end is destruction; their god is their belly; and their glory is in their shame: for they are immersed in earthly things.
verses.textLa: quorum finis interitus: quorum Deus venter est: et gloria in confusione ipsorum, qui terrena sapiunt.

verses.textEn: But our way of life is in heaven. And from heaven, too, we await the Savior, our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.textLa: Nostra autem conversatio in cælis est: unde etiam Salvatorem expectamus Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum,

verses.textEn: who will transform the body of our lowliness, according to the form of the body of his glory, by means of that power by which he is even able to subject all things to himself.
verses.textLa: qui reformabit corpus humilitatis nostræ, configuratum corpori claritatis suæ, secundum operationem, qua etiam possit subiicere sibi omnia.

verses.textEn: And so, my most beloved and most desired brothers, my joy and my crown: stand firm in this way, in the Lord, most beloved.
verses.textLa: Itaque fratres mei charissimi, et desideratissimi, gaudium meum, et corona mea: sic state in Domino, charissimi:

verses.textEn: I ask Euodia, and I beg Syntyche, to have the same understanding in the Lord.
verses.textLa: Evodiam rogo, et Syntychen deprecor idipsum sapere in Domino.
verses.notes: On the spiritual level of meaning, this verse refers to the Great Schism between the West and much of the East. The Church in the West is the Latin Rite, and Euodia is a Latin name. But Syntyche is a Greek name. So Euodia is a figure for the West, and Syntyche is a figure for those Eastern Churches that went astray from the Faith. The Holy Spirit is using the historical disagreement between these two women (the Church is often represented under the figure of a Bride) to represent the Great Schism. And notice that the Spirit 'asks' Euodia (the West) but 'begs' Syntyche (the Eastern schismatice) indicating that it is the Eastern schismatics who have erred. This verse is the Holy Spirit asking for the healing of the Great Schism.

verses.textEn: And I also ask you, as my genuine companion, to assist those women who have labored with me in the Gospel, with Clement and the rest of my assistants, whose names are in the Book of Life.
verses.textLa: Etiam rogo et te germane compar, adiuva illas, quæ mecum laboraverunt in Evangelio cum Clemente, et ceteris adiutoribus meis, quorum nomina sunt in libro vitæ.

verses.textEn: Rejoice in the Lord always. Again, I say, rejoice.
verses.textLa: Gaudete in Domino semper: iterum dico gaudete.

verses.textEn: Let your modesty be known to all men. The Lord is near.
verses.textLa: Modestia vestra nota sit omnibus hominibus: Dominus prope est.

verses.textEn: Be anxious about nothing. But in all things, with prayer and supplication, with acts of thanksgiving, let your petitions be made known to God.
verses.textLa: Nihil soliciti sitis: sed in omni oratione, et obsecratione, cum gratiarum actione petitiones vestræ innotescant apud Deum.

verses.textEn: And so shall the peace of God, which exceeds all understanding, guard your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: Et pax Dei, quæ exuperat omnem sensum, custodiat corda vestra, et intelligentias vestras in Christo Iesu.

verses.textEn: Concerning the rest, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is chaste, whatever is just, whatever is holy, whatever is worthy to be loved, whatever is of good repute, if there is any virtue, if there is any praiseworthy discipline: meditate on these.
verses.textLa: De cetero fratres, quæcumque sunt vera, quæcumque pudica, quæcumque iusta, quæcumque sancta, quæcumque amabilia, quæcumque bonæ famæ, siqua virtus, siqua laus disciplinæ, hæc cogitate.

verses.textEn: All the things that you have learned and accepted and heard and seen in me, do these. And so shall the God of peace be with you.
verses.textLa: Quæ et didicistis, et accepistis, et audistis, et vidistis in me, hæc agite: et Deus pacis erit vobiscum.

verses.textEn: Now I rejoice in the Lord exceedingly, because finally, after some time, your feelings for me have flourished again, just as you formerly felt. For you had been preoccupied.
verses.textLa: Gavisus sum autem in Domino vehementer, quoniam tandem aliquando refloruistis pro me sentire, sicut et sentiebatis: occupati autem eratis.

verses.textEn: I am not saying this as if out of need. For I have learned that, in whatever state I am, it is sufficient.
verses.textLa: Non quasi propter penuriam dico: ego enim didici, in quibus sum, sufficiens esse.

verses.textEn: I know how to be humbled, and I know how to abound. I am prepared for anything, anywhere: either to be full or to be hungry, either to have abundance or to endure scarcity.
verses.textLa: Scio et humiliari, scio et abundare: (ubique et in omnibus institutus sum) et satiari, et esurire, et abundare, et penuriam pati.

verses.textEn: Everything is possible in him who has strengthened me.
verses.textLa: Omnia possum in eo, qui me confortat.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, you have done well by sharing in my tribulation.
verses.textLa: Verumtamen bene fecistis, communicantes tribulationi meæ.

verses.textEn: But you also know, O Philippians, that at the beginning of the Gospel, when I set out from Macedonia, not a single church shared with me in the plan of giving and receiving, except you alone.
verses.textLa: Scitis autem et vos Philippenses, quod in principio Evangelii, quando profectus sum a Macedonia, nulla mihi ecclesia communicavit in ratione dati et accepti, nisi vos soli:

verses.textEn: For you even sent to Thessalonica, once, and then a second time, for what was useful to me.
verses.textLa: quia et Thessalonicam semel et bis in usum mihi misistis.

verses.textEn: It is not that I am seeking a gift. Instead, I seek the fruit that abounds to your benefit.
verses.textLa: Non quia quæro datum, sed requiro fructum abundantem in ratione vestra.

verses.textEn: But I have everything in abundance. I have been filled up, having received from Epaphroditus the things that you sent; this is an odor of sweetness, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing to God.
verses.textLa: Habeo autem omnia, et abundo: repletus sum, acceptis ab Epaphrodito quæ misistis odorem suavitatis, hostiam acceptam, placentem Deo.

verses.textEn: And may my God fulfill all your desires, according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: Deus autem meus impleat omne desiderium vestrum secundum divitias suas in gloria in Christo Iesu.

verses.textEn: And to God our Father be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.textLa: Deo autem et Patri nostro gloria in sæcula sæculorum: Amen.

verses.textEn: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: Salutate omnem sanctum in Christo Iesu.

verses.textEn: The brothers who are with me greet you. All the saints greet you, but especially those who are of Caesar’s household.
verses.textLa: Salutant vos, qui mecum sunt, fratres. Salutant vos omnes sancti, maxime autem qui de Cæsaris domo sunt.

verses.textEn: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.textLa: Gratia Domini nostri Iesu Christi cum spiritu vestro. Amen.
